1.2a.definition: it contains all the characters that are in that character set and the binary value that is assigned to each character.
a character set for all the characters on a standard keyboard and control codes
a character set which represents all the languages of the world (the first 128 characters are the same as ASCII code)

1.2b.definition: a little piece of sound that is recorded at regular time intervals.
the number of samples recorded each second.
the number of bits that are used to record each sound sample.

1.2c.definition: a very small dot of colour that is displayed with many others to create an image.
the number of bits that are used to create each colour in an image
additional data that is stored with an image that can provide information such as the dimensions of the image and the time and date the image was taken.
